page.title: 07RECREATION
page.content: Rural villages such as Alvington have varied and limited recreational and entertainment facilities. There is a Recreation ground in the village where cricket and football are played, children also have a play area with swings and roundabouts. At the British Legion Hall there is a Hand Bell Ringing Club and Old Time Dancing. There is also a mobile Library visiting once a week. Other leisure time pursuits include gardening, knitting, sewing and socialising at one or other of the two Public houses. Senior club for the over 60's meets once a month. There is a Carnival and Church Fete held every other year during the summer. Television and Radio are the main form of entertainment
